project.name: webmidi
project.description: A browser library making it easier to develop with the Web MIDI API.

WebMidi.name: WebMidi
todo: Allow triggering notes using usual name and octave
Yuidoc does not allow multiple exceptions (@throws) for a single method ?!
Add specific events for channel mode messages ?
Ability to listen to one controller in particular (by name or by number).

classitems.description: [read-only] Indicates whether the browser supports the Web MIDI API or not.
classitems.name: supported

classitems.description:
[read-only] Indicates whether the interface to the host's MIDI subsystem is still
active.
classitems.name: connected

classitems.description: [read-only] An array of all currently available MIDI inputs.
classitems.name: inputs

classitems.description: [read-only] An array of all currently available MIDI outputs.
classitems.name: inputs

classitems.description:
[read-only] Current MIDI performance time in milliseconds. This can be used to
queue events in the future.
classitems.name: time

classitems.description:
Event emitted when the interface's state changes. Typically, this happens when a
MIDI device is being plugged or unplugged. This event cannot be listened on a
specific MIDI channel, it is intended to be interface-wide. If a channel is
specified, it will be silently ignored.
classitems.name: statechange

classitems.description:
Event emitted when a note off MIDI message has been received on a specific
channel.
classitems.name: noteoff

props.name: target
props.description:
The target MIDI input where the event
                                   occurred.

props.name: data
props.description:
The raw MIDI message as an array of 8 bit
                                   values.

props.name: receivedTime
props.description:
The time when the event occurred (in
                                   milliseconds since start).

props.name: timeStamp
props.description:
The timestamp when the event occurred
                                   (in milliseconds since the epoch).

props.name: channel
props.description:
The channel where the event occurred (between
                                   0 and 15).

props.name: type
props.description: The type of event that occurred.

props.name: number
props.description: The MIDI note number.

props.name: name
props.description: The usual note name (C, C#, D, D#, etc.).

props.name: octave
props.description: The octave (between -3 and 5).

props.name: velocity
props.description: The release velocity (between 0 and 1).

classitems.description:
Checks if the Web MIDI API is available and then tries to connect to the host's MIDI
subsystem. If the operation succeeds, the `successHandler` callback is executed.
If not, the `errorHandler` callback is executed and passed a string describing the
error.

Depending on the host environment, calling this method may prompt the user for
authorization.
classitems.name: enable

params.name: successHandler
params.description: A function to execute upon success.

params.name: errorHandler
params.description:
A function to execute upon error. This function
                                   will be passed a string describing the error.

params.name: sysex
params.description: Whether to enable sysex or not

classitems.description:
Adds an event listener that will trigger a function callback when the specified event
happens. By default, the listener is system-wide (it will listen on all MIDI
channels) but this can be changed by passing one or more specific channel(s) as the
3rd parameter.

Here is a list of events that are dispatched by the `WebMidi` object and that can be
listened to.

Channel-specific MIDI events:

   * noteoff
   * noteon
   * keyaftertouch
   * controlchange
   * channelmode
   * programchange
   * channelaftertouch
   * pitchbend

System-wide MIDI events:

   * sysex
   * timecode
   * songposition
   * songselect
   * tuningrequest
   * clock
   * start
   * continue
   * stop
   * activesensing
   * reset
   * unknownsystemmessage

Interface event:

   * statechange

For system-wide events, the specified channel (if any) will be silently ignored. The
value "all" will be used instead.
classitems.name: addEventListener

params.name: type
params.description: The type of the event.

params.name: listener
params.description:
A callback function to execute when the
                                         specified event is detected.

params.name: channel
params.description:
The MIDI channel or array of channels to
                                         listen on. If set to 'all', all channels
                                         will trigger the callback function.

throws.description: The specified event type is not supported.

return.description:
Returns the `WebMidi` object so methods can
                                         be chained.

classitems.description:
Checks if the specified event type is already defined to trigger the listener
function on the specified channel. If the special value "all" is used for the
channel, the function will return `true` only  if all channels have the listener
defined.

For system-wide events (`onstatechange`, `sysex`, `start`, etc.), the channel
parameter is silently ignored.
classitems.name: hasEventListener

params.name: type
params.description: The type of the event.

params.name: listener
params.description: The callback function to check for.

params.name: channel
params.description:
The MIDI channel to check on. It can be a uint
                                   (between 0 and 15) or the special value "all".

throws.description:
WebMidi must be enabled before checking event
                                   listeners.

return.description:
Boolean value indicating whether or not the
                                   channel(s) already have this listener defined.

classitems.description:
Removes the specified listener from the requested channel(s). If the special value
"all" is used for the channel parameter, the function will remove the listener from
all channels.

For system-wide events (`onstatechange`, `sysex`, `start`, etc.), the channel
parameter is silently ignored.
classitems.name: removeEventListener

params.name: type
params.description: The type of the event.

params.name: listener
params.description: The callback function to check for.

params.name: channel
params.description:
The MIDI channel to check on. It can be a uint
                                   (between 0 and 15) or the special value "all".

throws.description:
WebMidi must be enabled before removing event
                                   listeners.

classitems.description:
Sends a MIDI message to one or all channels at the specified timestamp. Unless, you
are familiar with the details of the MIDI message format, you should not use this
method directly. Instead, use one of the helper methods: `playNote()`, `stopNote()`,
`sendControlChange()`, `sendSystemMessage()`, etc.
classitems.name: send

params.name: channel
params.description:
The MIDI channel number (between 0 and 15) or the
                                 string "all". You can view the available channels in
                                 `WebMidi.outputs`.

params.name: command
params.description:
The command number. Check out the constants in the
                                 WebMidi object for a list of available commands
                                 (0-255).

params.name: data
params.description:
Array of data bytes. The number of data bytes varies
                                 depending on the command.

params.name: timestamp
params.description:
The timestamp at which to schedule
                                 the event. You can use `WebMidi.time` to retrieve
                                 the current timestamp.

throws.description: The command must be an integer between 0 and 255.

return.description:
Returns the `WebMidi` object so methods can be
                                 chained.

classitems.description:
Sends a MIDI real-time or common system message to all available outputs. The
available messages are as follows:

System common messages:

   sysex
   timecode
   songposition
   songselect
   tuningrequest
   sysexend

System real-time messages:

   clock
   start
   continue
   stop
   activesensing
   reset
classitems.name: sendSystemMessage

params.name: command
params.description:
A string representing the command to send. The available
                           system commands are: sysex, timecode, songposition,
                           songselect, tuningrequest, sysexend, clock, start,
                           continue, stop, activesensing and reset.

params.name: data
params.description:
An array of data bytes to insert in the message. The
                           number of data bytes varies depending on the command.

params.name: delay
params.description:
The number of milliseconds to wait before actually sending
                           the command (using 0 will send the command immediately).

throws.description: The requested system command is not supported.

return.description: Returns the `WebMidi` object so methods can be chained.

classitems.description:
Sends a system exclusive message to all connected devices. The message will
automatically be properly terminated. It is generally suggested to keep system
exclusive messages to 64Kb or less.
classitems.name: sendSystemMessage

params.name: manufacturer
params.description:
A uint or an array of three uints between 0 and 127
                                 that identifies the targeted manufacturer.

params.name: data
params.description:
An array of uints between 0 and 127. This is the
                                 data you wish to transfer.

params.name: delay
params.description:
The number of milliseconds to wait before actually
                                 sending the command (using 0 will send the command
                                 immediately).

throws.description: WebMidi must be enabled sending messages.

return.description:
Returns the `WebMidi` object so methods can be
                                 chained.

classitems.description:
Sends a MIDI `note off` message to the specified channel for a single note or
multiple notes. You can delay the execution of the `note off` command by using the
`delay` parameter (milliseconds).
classitems.name: stopNote

params.name: channel
params.description:
The MIDI channel number (between 0 and 15). You
                                     can view available channels in the
                                     `WebMidi.outputs` array.

params.name: note
params.description:
The note or an array of notes to stop. The notes
                                     can be specified in one of two ways. The first
                                     way is by using the MIDI note number (an integer
                                     between 0 and 127). The second way is by using
                                     the note name followed by the octave (C3, G#4,
                                     F-1). The octave range should be between -3 and
                                     5.

params.name: velocity
params.description:
The velocity at which to release the note
                                     (between 0 and 1).

params.name: delay
params.description:
The number of milliseconds to wait before
                                     actually sending the `note off` message (using a
                                     negative number or 0 will stop the note
                                     immediately).

throws.description:
The release velocity must be a decimal number
                                     between 0 and 1.

return.description:
Returns the `WebMidi` object so methods can be
                                     chained.

classitems.description:
Requests the playback of a single note or multiple notes on the specified channel.
You can delay the execution of the `note on` command by using the `delay` parameter
(milliseconds).

If no duration is specified, the note will play until a matching `note off` is sent.
If a duration is specified, a `note off` will be automatically executed after said
duration.

Please note that if you do use a duration, the release velocity will always be 64. If
you want to tailor the release velocity, you need to use separate `playNote()` and
`stopNote()` calls.
classitems.name: playNote

params.name: channel
params.description:
The MIDI channel number (between 0 and 15). You
                                     can view available channels in the
                                     `WebMidi.outputs` array.

params.name: note
params.description:
The note to play or an array of notes to play.
                                     The notes can be specified in one of two ways.
                                     The first way is by using the MIDI note number
                                     (an integer between 0 and 127). The second way
                                     is by using the note name followed by the octave
                                     (C3, G#4, F-1). The octave range should be
                                     between -3 and 5.

params.name: velocity
params.description:
The velocity at which to play the note (between
                                     0 and 1).

params.name: duration
params.description:
The number of milliseconds to wait before
                                     sending a matching note off event. If left
                                     undefined, only a note on is sent.

params.name: delay
params.description:
The number of milliseconds to wait before
                                     actually sending the `note on` command (using a
                                     negative number or 0 will send the command
                                     immediately).

throws.description:
The velocity must be a decimal number between 0
                                     and 1.

return.description:
Returns the `WebMidi` object so methods can be
                                     chained.

classitems.description:
Returns a MIDI note number matching the note name passed in the form of a string
parameter. The note name must include the octave number which should be between -2
and 5: C5, G4, D#-1, F0, etc.
classitems.name: noteNameToNumber

params.name: name
params.description:
The name of the note in the form of a letter followed by an
                       octave number (between -2 and 5).

classitems.description:
Sends a MIDI `key aftertouch` message to the specified channel. This is a
key-specific aftertouch. For a channel-wide aftertouch message, use
`sendChannelAftertouch()`.
classitems.name: sendKeyAftertouch

params.name: channel
params.description:
The MIDI channel number (between 0 and 15). You can view
                             available channels in the `WebMidi.outputs` array.

params.name: note
params.description:
The MIDI number of the note whose pressure data is being
                             sent (0-127).

params.name: pressure
params.description: The pressure level to send (between 0 and 1)

params.name: delay
params.description:
The number of milliseconds to wait before actually
                             sending the `key aftertouch` command (using a negative
                             number or 0 will send the command immediately).

throws.description: The note number must be between 0 and 127.

return.description: Returns the `WebMidi` object so methods can be chained.

classitems.description: Sends a MIDI `control change` message to the specified channel.
classitems.name: sendControlChange

params.name: channel
params.description:
The MIDI channel number (between 0 and 15). You can view
                           available channels in the `WebMidi.outputs` array.

params.name: controller
params.description: The MIDI controller number (0-119)

params.name: value
params.description: The value to send (0-127).

params.name: delay
params.description:
The number of milliseconds to wait before actually sending
                           the `key aftertouch` command (using a negative number or 0
                           will send the command immediately).

return.description: Returns the `WebMidi` object so methods can be chained.

classitems.description: Sends a MIDI `channel mode` message to the specified channel.
classitems.name: sendChannelMode

params.name: channel
params.description:
The MIDI channel number (between 0 and 15). You can view
                           available channels in the `WebMidi.outputs` array.

params.name: command
params.description: The MIDI channel mode command (120-127)

params.name: value
params.description: The value to send (0-127)

params.name: delay
params.description:
The number of milliseconds to wait before actually sending
                           the `key aftertouch` command (using a negative number or 0
                           will send the command immediately).

return.description: Returns the `WebMidi` object so methods can be chained.

todo: il faut dcortiquer les channel mode en fonctions distinctes

classitems.description: Sends a MIDI `program change` message to the specified channel.
classitems.name: sendProgramChange

params.name: channel
params.description:
The MIDI channel number (between 0 and 15). You can view
                           available channels in the `WebMidi.outputs` array.

params.name: program
params.description: The MIDI patch (program) number (0-127)

params.name: delay
params.description:
The number of milliseconds to wait before actually sending
                           the `key aftertouch` command (using a negative number or 0
                           will send the command immediately).

throws.description: Program numbers must be between 0 and 127.

return.description: Returns the `WebMidi` object so methods can be chained.

classitems.description:
Sends a MIDI `channel aftertouch` message to the specified channel. For key-specific
aftertouch, instead use `sendKeyAftertouch()`.
classitems.name: sendChannelAftertouch

params.name: channel
params.description:
The MIDI channel number (between 0 and 15). You can view
                             available channels in the `WebMidi.outputs` array.

params.name: pressure
params.description: The pressure level (between 0 and 1)

params.name: delay
params.description:
The number of milliseconds to wait before actually
                             sending the `key aftertouch` command (using a negative
                             number or 0 will send the command immediately).

throws.description: WebMidi must be enabled before sending messages.

return.description: Returns the `WebMidi` object so methods can be chained.

classitems.description: Sends a MIDI `pitch bend` message to the specified channel.
classitems.name: sendPitchBend

params.name: channel
params.description:
The MIDI channel number (between 0 and 15). You can view
                           available channels in the `WebMidi.outputs` array.

params.name: level
params.description: The intensity level of the bend (between -1 and 1)

params.name: delay
params.description:
The number of milliseconds to wait before actually sending
                           the `key aftertouch` command (using a negative number or 0
                           will send the command immediately).

throws.description: Pitch bend value must be between -1 and 1.

return.description: Returns the `WebMidi` object so methods can be chained.

warnings.message: replacing incorrect tag: returns with return
